Detailed Description

An Integrator defines a method for simulating a System by integrating the equations of motion. This is an abstract class. Subclasses define particular integration methods.

Each Integrator object is bound to a particular Context which it integrates. This connection is specified by passing the Integrator as an argument to the constructor of the Context.

Member Function Documentation

virtual void OpenMM::Integrator::cleanup ( ) [inline, protected, virtual]

This will be called by the Context when it is destroyed to let the Integrator do any necessary cleanup. It will also get called again if the application calls reinitialize() on the Context.

Reimplemented in OpenMM::CustomIntegrator, OpenMM::RPMDIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableLangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::BrownianIntegrator, OpenMM::LangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableVerletIntegrator, and OpenMM::VerletIntegrator.

virtual double OpenMM::Integrator::computeKineticEnergy ( ) [protected, pure virtual]

Compute the kinetic energy of the system at the current time. This may be different from simply mv2/2. For example, a leapfrog integrator will store velocities offset by half a step, but the kinetic energy should be computed at the current time, not delayed by half a step.

Implemented in OpenMM::CustomIntegrator, OpenMM::RPMDIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableLangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::BrownianIntegrator, OpenMM::LangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableVerletIntegrator, OpenMM::VerletIntegrator, and OpenMM::NEBIntegrator.

double OpenMM::Integrator::getConstraintTolerance ( ) const [inline]

Get the distance tolerance within which constraints are maintained, as a fraction of the constrained distance.

virtual std::vector<std::string> OpenMM::Integrator::getKernelNames ( ) [protected, pure virtual]

Get the names of all Kernels used by this Integrator.

Implemented in OpenMM::CustomIntegrator, OpenMM::RPMDIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableLangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::BrownianIntegrator, OpenMM::LangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::NEBIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableVerletIntegrator, and OpenMM::VerletIntegrator.

double OpenMM::Integrator::getStepSize ( ) const [inline]

Get the size of each time step, in picoseconds. If this integrator uses variable time steps, the size of the most recent step is returned.

Returns:
the step size, measured in ps

Reimplemented in OpenMM::NEBIntegrator.

virtual void OpenMM::Integrator::initialize ( ContextImpl &  context) [protected, pure virtual]

This will be called by the Context when it is created. It informs the Integrator of what context it will be integrating, and gives it a chance to do any necessary initialization. It will also get called again if the application calls reinitialize() on the Context.

Implemented in OpenMM::CustomIntegrator, OpenMM::RPMDIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableLangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::BrownianIntegrator, OpenMM::LangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::NEBIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableVerletIntegrator, and OpenMM::VerletIntegrator.

void OpenMM::Integrator::setConstraintTolerance ( double  tol) [inline]

Set the distance tolerance within which constraints are maintained, as a fraction of the constrained distance.

void OpenMM::Integrator::setStepSize ( double  size) [inline]

Set the size of each time step, in picoseconds. If this integrator uses variable time steps, the effect of calling this method is undefined, and it may simply be ignored.

Parameters:
sizethe step size, measured in ps
virtual void OpenMM::Integrator::stateChanged ( State::DataType  changed) [inline, protected, virtual]

This will be called by the Context when the user modifies aspects of the context state, such as positions, velocities, or parameters. This gives the Integrator a chance to discard cached information. This is only called when the user modifies information using methods of the Context object. It is not called when a ForceImpl object modifies state information in its updateContextState() method (unless the ForceImpl calls a Context method to perform the modification).

Parameters:
changedthis specifies what aspect of the Context was changed

Reimplemented in OpenMM::CustomIntegrator, OpenMM::RPMDIntegrator, and OpenMM::NEBIntegrator.

virtual void OpenMM::Integrator::step ( int  steps) [pure virtual]

Advance a simulation through time by taking a series of time steps.

Parameters:
stepsthe number of time steps to take

Implemented in OpenMM::CustomIntegrator, OpenMM::RPMDIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableLangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::BrownianIntegrator, OpenMM::LangevinIntegrator, OpenMM::NEBIntegrator, OpenMM::VariableVerletIntegrator, and OpenMM::VerletIntegrator.
